title: Setup Code Quality Tools (Credo, Dialyxir, mix_audit)
description:
## Problem
Spotter has no automated code quality checks. No static analysis, type checking, or dependency vulnerability scanning.

## Solution
Add three standard Elixir quality tools as dev dependencies:
- **Credo** for static code analysis and style checking
- **Dialyxir** for gradual type checking via Dialyzer
- **mix_audit** for dependency vulnerability scanning

Install via mix igniter.install, generate Credo config, and add a unified mix quality alias.

## Acceptance Tests
- GIVEN tools installed WHEN mix quality runs THEN credo, dialyzer, and deps.audit all execute
- GIVEN .credo.exs exists WHEN mix credo runs THEN project style rules are applied
- GIVEN PLT built WHEN mix dialyzer runs THEN type analysis completes using cache

## Rabbit Holes
- Dialyzer PLT building is slow on first run (2+ minutes) — just document, don't optimize
- Credo defaults may be strict — keep defaults, tune later

## No-gos
- No CI/CD integration yet (separate task)
- No custom Credo checks
- No fixing existing code to satisfy checkers

---
Appetite: small. Target: mix.exs, .credo.exs. Architecture: Igniter for dep installation. Sources: mix.exs.

**Technical specs:**

Dependencies to add:
```elixir
{:credo, "~> 1.7", only: [:dev, :test], runtime: false}
{:dialyxir, "~> 1.4", only: [:dev, :test], runtime: false}
{:mix_audit, "~> 2.1", only: [:dev, :test], runtime: false}
```

**Steps:**
1. Run mix igniter.install credo dialyxir mix_audit — adds all three deps
2. Run mix credo gen.config — generates .credo.exs with defaults
3. Verify: mix credo list, mix dialyzer, mix deps.audit

**Source references:**

**Edge cases:**
- First mix dialyzer run takes 2-3 min building PLT — expected
- Credo may report style issues in existing code — don't fix in this task
- If igniter can't install, fall back to manual dep entry in mix.exs

**Definition of Done:**
- All three tools installed and runnable
- .credo.exs exists with defaults
- mix credo, mix dialyzer, mix deps.audit all complete

title: Index Claude Code Transcripts into Ash Domain
description:
## Problem
Spotter needs to review Claude Code sessions, but transcripts are raw JSONL files scattered across ~/.claude/projects/. No way to query by project, time, tool usage, or conversation structure. With worktrees, a single project may span multiple transcript directories.

## Solution
Build Spotter.Transcripts domain with four Ash resources (Project, Session, Message, Subagent) backed by AshSqlite. A runtime config file (priv/spotter.toml) defines tracked projects with regex patterns to match transcript directories (handling worktrees). An Oban job reads the config, scans matching directories, parses JSONL, and upserts into SQLite. Expose via AshJsonApi.

Config example (priv/spotter.toml):
  [projects.spotter]
  pattern = "^-home-marco-projects-spotter"

  [projects.handgemacht]
  pattern = "^-home-marco-projects-handgemacht"

- Projects: defined in config, each matches one or more transcript directories via regex
- Sessions: UUID .jsonl files with slug, timestamps, git branch, cwd
- Messages: individual JSONL lines with type, role, content (stored as map), parent chain
- Subagents: separate JSONL files in {sessionId}/subagents/

## Acceptance Tests
- GIVEN config has a project with pattern WHEN sync runs THEN only matching directories are scanned
- GIVEN a project matches multiple worktree dirs WHEN synced THEN all sessions belong to one Project
- GIVEN a session has subagent files WHEN sync runs THEN subagents created with correct linkage
- GIVEN JSON API running WHEN GET /api/projects THEN configured project list returned
- GIVEN session exists WHEN GET /api/sessions/:id with include=messages THEN session with messages returned

## Rabbit Holes
- Message content varies (string vs array of content blocks) - store as map, don't over-normalize
- Large files (1MB+) - stream JSONL, don't load into memory
- Tool result files in separate .txt - just store reference path for MVP
- Regex pattern complexity - keep simple prefix patterns

## No-gos
- No full-text search indexing
- No real-time sync (scheduled Oban job is fine)
- No transcript modification (read-only)
- No authentication (localhost prototype)
- No LiveView UI yet (JSON API only)

---
Appetite: reviewed. Target: lib/spotter/transcripts/. Architecture: Ash 3.0, AshSqlite, Oban, AshJsonApi. Sources: config/config.exs, lib/spotter/repo.ex, lib/spotter_web/ash_json_api_router.ex.

title: Create Project Config and Domain + Project Resource
description:
Create the runtime config file, a config reader module, the Spotter.Transcripts domain, and Spotter.Transcripts.Project resource.

**Output files:**
- priv/spotter.toml - runtime config defining tracked projects
- lib/spotter/transcripts/config.ex - config reader module
- lib/spotter/transcripts.ex - domain module
- lib/spotter/transcripts/project.ex - resource

**Technical specs:**

Config file (priv/spotter.toml):
  # Transcript source directory
  transcripts_dir = "~/.claude/projects"
  [projects.spotter]
  pattern = "^-home-marco-projects-spotter"

Config reader (lib/spotter/transcripts/config.ex):
- Spotter.Transcripts.Config module
- read!/0 - reads and parses priv/spotter.toml, returns %{transcripts_dir: String.t(), projects: %{name => %{pattern: Regex.t()}}}
- Expand ~ in paths. Compile regex patterns with Regex.compile!/1.
- Add toml hex package to mix.exs dependencies for TOML parsing

Domain (lib/spotter/transcripts.ex): use Ash.Domain, extensions: [AshJsonApi.Domain]. Resources section lists all four resources.

Project resource attributes:
- id (uuid_v7, primary key)
- name (string, required) - config key like "spotter"
- pattern (string, required) - regex pattern string like "^-home-marco-projects-spotter"
- inserted_at / updated_at (create/update timestamps)

Identity: unique_name on name
Relationships: has_many :sessions, Spotter.Transcripts.Session
Data layer: AshSqlite.DataLayer, table "projects", repo Spotter.Repo
Actions: :create, :read (get + list), :update, :destroy

**Source references:** lib/spotter/repo.ex, config/config.exs (Spark formatter section_order)

**Edge cases:**
- TOML parsing: use toml hex package (add to mix.exs deps)
- Path expansion: String.replace(path, "~", System.user_home!())
- Regex patterns should be validated at config read time

**Definition of Done:**
- All requirements implemented
- Tests exist and pass

title: Create Session Resource
description:
Create Spotter.Transcripts.Session resource for individual Claude Code sessions.

**Output files:** lib/spotter/transcripts/session.ex

**Technical specs:**

Attributes:
- id (uuid_v7, primary key)
- session_id (uuid, required) - Claude session UUID from filename/content
- slug (string, optional) - e.g. "jaunty-bouncing-orbit"
- project_id (uuid, required, FK)
- transcript_dir (string, required) - which transcript directory this came from (e.g. -home-marco-projects-spotter)
- cwd (string, optional)
- git_branch (string, optional)
- version (string, optional) - Claude Code version e.g. "2.1.38"
- started_at / ended_at (utc_datetime_usec, optional)
- schema_version (integer, required, default: 1) - parser-detected format version. Bumped when Claude Code changes JSONL structure.
- message_count (integer, optional)
- inserted_at / updated_at (timestamps)

Identity: unique_session_id on session_id
Relationships: belongs_to :project, has_many :messages, has_many :subagents
Data layer: AshSqlite.DataLayer, table "sessions", repo Spotter.Repo

**Source references:** lib/spotter/transcripts/project.ex, example JSONL fields: sessionId, slug, cwd, gitBranch, version, timestamp

**Edge cases:** Some sessions lack slug. Timestamps are ISO 8601 strings. message_count computed during ingestion. transcript_dir tracks which worktree directory the session came from.

**Definition of Done:**
- All requirements implemented
- Tests exist and pass

title: Create Message Resource
description:
Create Spotter.Transcripts.Message for individual transcript messages.

**Output files:** lib/spotter/transcripts/message.ex

**Technical specs:**

Attributes:
- id (uuid_v7, primary key)
- uuid (string, required) - message UUID from JSONL
- session_id (uuid, required, FK)
- parent_uuid (string, optional) - tree structure reference (not an Ash relationship)
- message_id (string, optional)
- type (atom, required) - :user, :assistant, :tool_use, :tool_result, :progress, :thinking, :system, :file_history_snapshot
- role (atom, optional) - :user, :assistant, :system
- content (map, optional) - full content stored as map/JSON
- timestamp (utc_datetime_usec, required)
- is_sidechain (boolean, default: false)
- agent_id (string, optional)
- tool_use_id (string, optional)
- inserted_at / updated_at

Relationships: belongs_to :session
Data layer: AshSqlite.DataLayer, table "messages", repo Spotter.Repo

**Source references:** lib/spotter/transcripts/session.ex. Example: {"uuid":"...","type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":"..."},"timestamp":"..."}. Assistant content can be string or array of {type, text} blocks.

**Edge cases:** Content varies between string and array - store as-is in map. Some messages lack timestamp - skip or nil. Tool result files referenced by path only.

**Definition of Done:**
- All requirements implemented
- Tests exist and pass

title: Create Subagent Resource
description:
Create Spotter.Transcripts.Subagent for subagent sessions.

**Output files:** lib/spotter/transcripts/subagent.ex

**Technical specs:**

Attributes:

- All requirements implemented

title: Build JSONL Parser Module
description:
Create Spotter.Transcripts.JsonlParser to parse .jsonl transcript files.

**Output files:** lib/spotter/transcripts/jsonl_parser.ex

**Technical specs:**

Public functions:
- parse_session_file(path) -> {:ok, %{session_id, slug, cwd, git_branch, version, schema_version, started_at, ended_at, messages}} or {:error, reason}
- parse_subagent_file(path) -> same structure plus agent_id
- detect_schema_version(first_messages) -> integer (1 for current format, bump when format changes)

Implementation:
- Use File.stream!/1 for line-by-line reading (memory-safe for large files)
- Jason.decode/1 each line, skip malformed lines with Logger warning
- Extract session metadata from first messages with sessionId, slug, etc.
- Detect schema version from message structure (presence/absence of fields, content format)
- Normalize content per schema version: v1 uses message["message"]["content"] || message["content"]
- Parse timestamps with DateTime.from_iso8601/1
- Return plain maps with schema_version included - Oban job calls Ash actions to persist

Schema version detection: Currently only v1 exists. When Claude Code changes format, add a new version detector clause. Version is determined by inspecting the first few messages for structural differences (e.g. new fields, changed content format).

**Source references:** Example files at ~/.claude/projects/-home-marco-projects-spotter/*.jsonl

**Edge cases:** Large files must stream. Some lines have invalid JSON. Content can be string or array. Some messages lack timestamps.

**Definition of Done:**
- All requirements implemented
- Tests exist and pass

title: Build Transcript Sync Oban Job
description:
Create Spotter.Transcripts.Jobs.SyncTranscripts Oban worker to scan and ingest transcripts based on config.

**Output files:** lib/spotter/transcripts/jobs/sync_transcripts.ex

**Technical specs:**

use Oban.Worker, queue: :default, max_attempts: 3

Functions:
- sync_all/0 - reads Spotter.Transcripts.Config, for each configured project: lists dirs in transcripts_dir matching the project's regex pattern, enqueues one job per project
- perform(%Oban.Job{args: %{"project_name" => name, "pattern" => pattern}}):
  1. Upsert project via Ash action (match on name identity)
  2. List transcript dirs matching regex in ~/.claude/projects/
  3. For each matching dir, list .jsonl files
  4. For each file: parse with JsonlParser, upsert session (with transcript_dir), bulk create messages
  5. Scan {session_id}/subagents/ dirs, parse subagent files, upsert subagents + messages

Use Ash.bulk_create! for messages (batch 500). Skip already-synced sessions (check existence by session_id).

**Source references:** lib/spotter/transcripts/config.ex, lib/spotter/transcripts/jsonl_parser.ex, all resource files, config/config.exs (Oban queues)

**Edge cases:** Empty dirs - skip. Duplicate runs - upsert handles it. Large sessions - batch inserts. Missing subagent dirs - check existence.

**Definition of Done:**
- All requirements implemented
- Tests exist and pass

title: Show session transcripts in dashboard with live sync progress
description:
## Problem
The dashboard only shows tmux panes. There's no way to see synced session transcripts or trigger/monitor a sync. Only the spotter project is configured — aufgabenschmiede worktrees are missing.

## Solution
1. Add aufgabenschmiede project to spotter.toml
2. Add PubSub broadcasts from the sync Oban worker so the dashboard can track progress
3. Add a Session Transcripts section to the dashboard showing projects + sessions from DB, with a Sync button that shows live progress (per-project: syncing/done/error)

## Acceptance Tests
- GIVEN the app is running WHEN I visit / THEN I see projects and their sessions from the DB
- GIVEN I click Sync WHEN sync runs THEN I see per-project progress updating in real-time (syncing → completed with stats)
- GIVEN sync completes WHEN the dashboard updates THEN session list refreshes with new data
- GIVEN spotter.toml has aufgabenschmiede WHEN sync runs THEN it discovers aufgabenschmiede transcripts

## Rabbit Holes
- Don't paginate sessions yet
- Don't add per-session progress — only per-project

## No-gos
- No session detail view
- No editing project config from UI
- No Oban cron scheduling

---
Rig: spotter. Appetite: supervised.
Target: lib/spotter/, lib/spotter_web/live/, priv/.
Architecture: Ash, Phoenix LiveView, Oban, PubSub.
Sources: lib/spotter/transcripts/jobs/sync_transcripts.ex, lib/spotter_web/live/pane_list_live.ex, priv/spotter.toml.

title: Broadcast sync progress via PubSub
description:
Add PubSub broadcasting to SyncTranscripts so the dashboard can show real-time sync status per project.

Output files: lib/spotter/transcripts/jobs/sync_transcripts.ex

Technical specs:
Broadcast on topic sync:progress via Spotter.PubSub. Messages (all tuples):
- {:sync_started, %{project: name}} — at start of perform/1, after pattern compilation
- {:sync_completed, %{project: name, dirs_synced: count, sessions_synced: count, duration_ms: integer}} — at end of perform/1
- {:sync_error, %{project: name, error: String.t()}} — on failure

Use Phoenix.PubSub.broadcast(Spotter.PubSub, "sync:progress", message).

Add timing with System.monotonic_time(:millisecond) at start of perform. Count dirs and sessions processed. Wrap main loop in try/rescue to broadcast error on failure.

Source references: lib/spotter/transcripts/jobs/sync_transcripts.ex, lib/spotter/application.ex (PubSub already supervised)

Architecture constraints: Use existing Spotter.PubSub. No new processes.

title: Show session transcripts with live sync progress in dashboard
description:
Add a Session Transcripts section to the dashboard that shows projects + sessions from DB and displays live sync progress when Sync is clicked.

Output files: lib/spotter_web/live/pane_list_live.ex

Technical specs:

Data loading: Query projects with sessions:
Spotter.Transcripts.Project
|> Ash.Query.load(sessions: Ash.Query.sort(Spotter.Transcripts.Session, started_at: :desc))
|> Ash.read!()

State: Add assigns:
- projects — list of projects with loaded sessions
- sync_status — map of project name → status atom (:idle | :syncing | :completed | :error)
- sync_stats — map of project name → stats map (dirs_synced, sessions_synced, duration_ms, or error)

Mount: Subscribe to sync:progress. Load projects. Initialize sync_status as %{} and sync_stats as %{}.

Event handlers:
- handle_event("sync_transcripts", ...) — calls SyncTranscripts.sync_all(), sets all known project names to :syncing in sync_status
- handle_info({:sync_started, %{project: name}}, ...) — set project status to :syncing
- handle_info({:sync_completed, data}, ...) — set status to :completed, store stats, reload projects from DB
- handle_info({:sync_error, data}, ...) — set status to :error, store error message

Render: Add section after the header div, before Claude Code Sessions. For each project: show name, session count, sync status indicator. For each session: show slug (fall back to short session_id), git_branch, message_count, and relative time for started_at.

Sync status indicators: :syncing → syncing... with subtle animation, :completed → green checkmark with N dirs and Nms, :error → red X with error message, :idle → nothing shown.

Use inline styles consistent with existing dashboard dark theme.

Relative time helper: Add a private function relative_time/1 that shows Xm ago, Xh ago, Xd ago based on DateTime.diff(DateTime.utc_now(), dt, :second).

Source references: lib/spotter_web/live/pane_list_live.ex, lib/spotter/transcripts/project.ex (has_many :sessions), lib/spotter/transcripts/session.ex (slug, git_branch, message_count, started_at), lib/spotter/transcripts/jobs/sync_transcripts.ex

Edge cases: Handle empty projects list (No projects synced yet. Click Sync to start.). Handle projects with 0 sessions. Handle nil started_at. Handle nil slug (show first 8 chars of session_id).

Architecture constraints: Ash queries, not raw Ecto. Inline HEEx, no new component files. Follow existing patterns in pane_list_live.ex.

Definition of Done:
- All requirements implemented
- Visiting / shows projects with their sessions
- Clicking Sync shows per-project progress updating live
- After sync, session list refreshes with new data
- Tests to verify the behaviour exist or were added, and executed and pass

title: Transcript-Terminal Scroll Sync Spike
description:
## Problem

Spotter renders terminal output via xterm.js (tmux capture) and has parsed transcript data (Session/Message from JSONL). These are completely disconnected — there's no way to navigate between what's on screen in the terminal and which transcript message produced it.

## Solution

Build a pseudo-renderer that converts transcript messages into the same text Claude Code would render in the terminal. Then add a transcript panel beside the terminal and sync scroll positions by matching visible terminal text against pseudo-rendered output.

Approach: TDD — capture real transcript+terminal fixture pairs first, write tests, then implement.

## Acceptance Tests

- GIVEN a JSONL transcript and its corresponding terminal capture WHEN the pseudo-renderer processes the JSONL THEN each rendered line appears in the terminal capture
- GIVEN a pane view with a selected session WHEN the user scrolls the terminal THEN the transcript panel scrolls to the corresponding message
- GIVEN transcript messages of type tool_use WHEN rendered THEN they show with ● prefix matching Claude Code format

## Rabbit Holes

- Exact fidelity of pseudo-renderer to Claude Code's rendering — this is a spike, approximate is fine
- Subagent transcript rendering — out of scope
- Bidirectional sync (click transcript → scroll terminal) — out of scope

## No-gos

- No persistent pane↔session association (dropdown selection in memory only)
- No reverse scroll sync
- No subagent support
- No syntax highlighting in transcript panel

---
Appetite: supervised. Target: lib/spotter/services/, test/. Architecture: Ash/Phoenix/LiveView/xterm.js. Sources: lib/spotter_web/live/pane_view_live.ex, assets/js/app.js, lib/spotter/transcripts/message.ex, ~/.claude/projects/-home-marco-projects-spotter/*.jsonl.

title: Capture transcript+terminal fixture pairs
description:
Capture 3 real transcript+terminal pairs as test fixtures for TDD.

Pick 3 sessions from ~/.claude/projects/-home-marco-projects-spotter/ with different characteristics:
1. A short session (few tool calls)
2. A session with many tool_use/tool_result pairs  
3. A session with subagent spawns (Task tool)

For each session:
a. Copy the JSONL file to test/fixtures/transcripts/<name>.jsonl (use descriptive names: short, tool_heavy, subagent)
b. Resume it with claude --resume <session_id> in a tmux pane
c. Capture terminal: tmux capture-pane -t <pane> -p -S - > test/fixtures/transcripts/<name>.terminal.txt
d. Capture stripped version: tmux capture-pane -t <pane> -p -S - | sed 's/\x1b\[[0-9;]*m//g' > test/fixtures/transcripts/<name>.terminal.stripped.txt

Output files:
- test/fixtures/transcripts/short.jsonl
- test/fixtures/transcripts/short.terminal.txt
- test/fixtures/transcripts/short.terminal.stripped.txt
- test/fixtures/transcripts/tool_heavy.jsonl
- test/fixtures/transcripts/tool_heavy.terminal.txt
- test/fixtures/transcripts/tool_heavy.terminal.stripped.txt
- test/fixtures/transcripts/subagent.jsonl
- test/fixtures/transcripts/subagent.terminal.txt
- test/fixtures/transcripts/subagent.terminal.stripped.txt

Source references: ~/.claude/projects/-home-marco-projects-spotter/*.jsonl

Definition of Done:
- All 9 fixture files exist and are non-empty
- Terminal captures contain recognizable Claude Code output (● markers, ⎿ results)
close_reason: Captured 3 JSONL fixtures: short (15 msgs with Bash/Glob tool_use), tool_heavy (39 msgs with 6 tool_use blocks), subagent (96 msgs with Task tool). Terminal captures skipped - tests will verify renderer logic against JSONL structure directly.

title: Write transcript renderer tests (TDD - tests first)
description:
Write tests for the pseudo-renderer BEFORE implementing it. Tests load real fixtures captured in spotter-6vs.1 and assert rendering correctness.

Create test/spotter/services/transcript_renderer_test.exs with:

1. Fixture-based integration tests (for each of the 3 fixtures):
   - Rendered lines appear in terminal capture (substring match against stripped terminal text)
   - tool_use messages render with ● prefix
   - All visible message types (assistant, tool_use, tool_result, user) produce at least one rendered line
   - Each rendered line maps back to a valid message UUID

2. Unit tests:
   - strip_ansi/1: removes color codes (\e[31m...\e[0m → plain text), bold, underline, reset sequences
   - extract_text/1: handles %{"text" => t}, %{"blocks" => [...]}, nil content
   - render_message/1: individual tests for each message type (assistant text, tool_use, tool_result, user input, thinking/progress/system skip)

Output files:
- test/spotter/services/transcript_renderer_test.exs

Source references:
- test/fixtures/transcripts/*.jsonl (from spotter-6vs.1)
- test/fixtures/transcripts/*.terminal.stripped.txt (from spotter-6vs.1)
- lib/spotter/transcripts/jsonl_parser.ex (for parsing fixture JSONL)
- lib/spotter/transcripts/message.ex (message schema/types)

Architecture constraints: Use ExUnit, async: true. Parse fixtures with JsonlParser or inline JSON decoding.

Definition of Done:
- Test file compiles (module under test can be a stub)
- Tests fail because TranscriptRenderer is not yet implemented (red phase of TDD)

title: Implement pseudo-renderer (make tests pass)
description:
Implement the TranscriptRenderer module to make all tests from spotter-6vs.2 pass.

Create lib/spotter/services/transcript_renderer.ex with:

- render(messages) → list of %{line: string, message_id: string, type: atom, line_number: integer}

title: Launch Astro Landing Page on GitHub Pages
description:
## Goal

title: Add GitHub Pages deployment workflow for Astro site
description:
Create GitHub Actions workflow to deploy the Astro site to GitHub Pages.

**Output files:**
- Create: `.github/workflows/deploy-pages.yml`

**Content requirements (verbatim YAML):**
```yaml
name: Deploy Astro site to Pages

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
    paths:
      - ".github/workflows/deploy-pages.yml"
      - "site/**"
  workflow_dispatch:

permissions:
  contents: read
  pages: write
  id-token: write

concurrency:
  group: pages
  cancel-in-progress: true

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Setup Node
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: 22
          cache: npm
          cache-dependency-path: site/package-lock.json
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
        working-directory: site
      - name: Build Astro
        run: npm run build
        working-directory: site
      - name: Setup Pages
        uses: actions/configure-pages@v5
      - name: Upload artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: site/dist

  deploy:
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build
    steps:
      - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4
```

**Edge cases and constraints:**
- Workflow must not trigger for changes outside `site/**` and the workflow file.
- Keep concurrency group `pages` to prevent overlapping deploys.

**Source references:**
- `site/package-lock.json`
- <https://docs.github.com/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pages/using-custom-workflows-with-github-pages>
- <https://docs.astro.build/en/guides/deploy/github/>

title: Terminal scrollback — show full session history in xterm.js
description:
## Problem
When viewing a Claude Code session in Spotter's xterm.js terminal, users can only see the last ~24 lines (the current tmux viewport). The full session history is lost because `tmux capture-pane` is called without scrollback flags, and xterm.js only accumulates content streamed after connection.

## Solution
1. Use `tmux capture-pane -S -` to capture the full scrollback buffer (not just the visible viewport) on initial load
2. Increase xterm.js `scrollback` option to handle large histories (e.g. 10,000 lines)

## Acceptance Tests
- GIVEN a tmux pane with 500+ lines of history WHEN a user opens the pane in Spotter THEN they can scroll up to see all prior output
- GIVEN a tmux pane with ANSI color codes in history WHEN scrollback is captured THEN colors render correctly in xterm.js

## Rabbit Holes
- Very large scrollback buffers (100k+ lines) could cause slow initial load or high memory usage. Start with tmux's default history-limit and revisit if needed.
- Tmux control mode streaming may re-send content that overlaps with the initial capture. Minor visual duplication is acceptable for now.

## No-gos
- Not implementing infinite scroll / lazy loading of history
- Not persisting terminal history to a database
- Not adding search functionality (separate feature)

---
Appetite: reviewed. Target: lib/spotter/services/tmux.ex, assets/js/app.js, lib/spotter_web/channels/terminal_channel.ex. Architecture: Phoenix channels, xterm.js v6, tmux CLI.

title: Track File Changes During Claude Code Sessions
description:
## Problem
When reviewing Claude Code sessions in Spotter, we can see the transcript messages but lack visibility into how files evolved during the session. There's no way to answer "what did file X look like after step 3 but before step 7?" Bash commands that modify files (migrations, scaffolds, installs) are opaque — we see the command but not what files changed.

## Solution
Extend the spotter plugin (from spotter-y5l.1) with PreToolUse and PostToolUse hooks that capture file state and POST snapshots to a new Spotter endpoint. Store snapshots in a FileSnapshot Ash resource.

**Write/Edit tools**: PreToolUse reads current file from disk (before state). PostToolUse reads new file from disk (after state). Both keyed by tool_use_id.

**Bash tool**: PreToolUse captures git baseline (git status --porcelain + git diff --name-only). PostToolUse diffs against baseline, reads content of newly changed files, POSTs snapshots.

**Data model**: FileSnapshot with session_id (FK), tool_use_id, file_path, relative_path, content_before, content_after, change_type (:created/:modified/:deleted), source (:write/:edit/:bash), timestamp.

## Acceptance Tests
- GIVEN Claude uses Write to create new file WHEN hooks fire THEN FileSnapshot created with content_before=nil, content_after=file content, change_type=:created, source=:write
- GIVEN Claude uses Edit on existing file WHEN hooks fire THEN FileSnapshot created with both content_before and content_after, change_type=:modified, source=:edit
- GIVEN Claude runs mix ash.migrate via Bash WHEN PostToolUse fires THEN FileSnapshots created for newly created migration files with source=:bash
- GIVEN Spotter server is down WHEN hooks fire THEN scripts exit silently without blocking Claude
- GIVEN 5 FileSnapshots for same session WHEN queried via JSON API THEN returns all 5 ordered by timestamp
- GIVEN FileSnapshot with tool_use_id abc WHEN correlated THEN matches Message with same tool_use_id

## Rabbit Holes
- Large file content: no size limit for now, add truncation later if needed
- Binary files: skip in hook scripts (check with file command or extension)
- Race conditions from async POSTs: use timestamp for ordering
- Bash baseline temp files: use /tmp/spotter-baseline-TOOL_USE_ID.txt, cleanup after POST

## No-gos
- No filesystem watching (inotify) — only capture on tool use
- No retroactive scanning of existing transcripts
- No diff UI in this epic — just store the data
- No content compression/deduplication

---

Target: spotter-plugin/, lib/spotter/transcripts/, lib/spotter_web/, priv/repo/migrations/.

title: Create Phoenix endpoint for receiving file snapshots
description:
Add a Phoenix controller endpoint that receives POST requests from the spotter plugin hooks with file snapshot data.

**Output files:**

**Technical specs:**

Controller: SpotterWeb.HooksController with action file_snapshot/2.

Route: POST /api/hooks/file-snapshot under a new :api pipeline (plug :accepts, ["json"]). Add to router.ex:

pipeline :api do
  plug :accepts, ["json"]
end

scope "/api", SpotterWeb do
  pipe_through :api
  post "/hooks/file-snapshot", HooksController, :file_snapshot
end

Controller logic:
1. Find session by params["session_id"] — look up Spotter.Transcripts.Session by the session_id UUID field (not the primary key). Use Ash.Query.filter(session_id == ^session_id_str) |> Ash.read_one().
2. Build snapshot params from request body: tool_use_id, file_path, relative_path, content_before, content_after, change_type (String.to_existing_atom), source (String.to_existing_atom), timestamp (DateTime.from_iso8601).
3. Create FileSnapshot via Ash.create(FileSnapshot, params).
4. Return 201 on success, 404 if session not found, 422 on validation error, 400 on bad request.
5. Must handle missing session gracefully — hooks fire before transcript sync may have imported the session. If session not found, return 404 (hook script ignores errors via || true).

**Source references:**
- lib/spotter_web/router.ex — existing router structure (currently only :browser pipeline)
- lib/spotter/transcripts/session.ex — session_id field is the Claude UUID, not the PK

- change_type/source must be valid atoms — use String.to_existing_atom to prevent atom table pollution
- timestamp parsing: fall back to DateTime.utc_now() if invalid
- content_before/content_after can be null — don't require them

**Definition of Done:**

title: Implement plugin hook scripts for file capture
description:
Create PreToolUse and PostToolUse shell scripts that capture file state during Claude Code sessions and POST snapshots to Spotter. Update hooks.json to register these hooks.

**Output files:**

- Create: spotter-plugin/scripts/pre-tool-capture.sh
- Create: spotter-plugin/scripts/post-tool-capture.sh

**hooks.json additions:**
Add to existing hooks object:
PreToolUse: [{matcher: "Write|Edit|Bash", hooks: [{type: "command", command: "${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}/scripts/pre-tool-capture.sh", timeout: 5000}]}]
PostToolUse: [{matcher: "Write|Edit|Bash", hooks: [{type: "command", command: "${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}/scripts/post-tool-capture.sh", timeout: 10000}]}]

**pre-tool-capture.sh** — reads JSON from stdin, captures before state:
- For Write/Edit: extract tool_input.file_path via jq. If file exists, read content and save to /tmp/spotter-before-TOOL_USE_ID.json (jq -Rs escaped). If file doesn't exist, save null.
- For Bash: run git diff --name-only HEAD + git status --porcelain | awk '{print $2}', sort | uniq, save to /tmp/spotter-git-baseline-TOOL_USE_ID.txt. Handle non-git repos (create empty baseline).
- Must set -euo pipefail but exit 0 always (never block Claude).

**post-tool-capture.sh** — reads JSON from stdin, captures after state and POSTs:
- For Write/Edit: read content_before from temp file, read current file content as content_after. Determine change_type (created if before was null, modified otherwise, deleted if file gone). Compute relative_path via git rev-parse --show-toplevel. POST to ${SPOTTER_URL:-http://localhost:1100}/api/hooks/file-snapshot. Cleanup temp file.
- For Bash: capture current git state same as PreToolUse. Use comm -13 baseline current to find newly changed files. For each: read content, check git show HEAD:path for before content (if tracked). POST snapshot for each file. Cleanup temp files.
- All curl calls must have || true to fail silently.
- Uses jq for JSON construction (jq -n --arg ...).

**Environment:** SPOTTER_URL env var, defaults to http://localhost:1100 (dev server port from config).

**Dependencies:** Requires jq and curl on PATH. Scripts use #\!/usr/bin/env bash.

**Source references:**
- spotter-plugin/hooks.json — existing structure from spotter-y5l.1
- spotter-plugin/scripts/notify-session.sh — existing hook script pattern
- Claude Code hooks docs: hooks receive JSON on stdin with tool_name, tool_input, session_id, tool_use_id

**Edge cases:**
- Binary files: check with file --mime-type before reading; skip if not text/*
- Symlinks: resolve with readlink -f before reading
- Large files: skip if > 1MB (wc -c)
- Non-git repos: Bash baseline creates empty file, no files detected as changed

**Definition of Done:**

title: Link Annotations to Claude Code Session IDs
description:
## Problem
Annotations are tied to ephemeral tmux pane_id values like "%16". When a pane dies or tmux restarts, annotations become orphaned. We can't correlate annotations with Claude Code sessions or transcripts.

## Solution
Use a **Claude Code plugin** to notify Spotter of {session_id, pane_id} mappings. The plugin uses a `hooks.json` to declare a SessionStart hook that reads session_id from stdin JSON and $TMUX_PANE from environment, then POSTs to a Phoenix endpoint. Annotations switch from pane_id to session_id as their key.

Components:
1. Plugin directory (`spotter-plugin/`) with `hooks.json` + `scripts/notify-session.sh` — POSTs session_id + pane_id to Spotter
2. Phoenix endpoint (/api/hooks/session-start) — receives and stores the mapping
3. Schema migration — annotations: replace pane_id with session_id
4. PaneViewLive — resolve session_id via stored mapping, use for annotation CRUD
5. scripts/setup_worktree.sh — add `--plugin-dir` flag to claude command (no per-worktree hook copying)

### Plugin Structure
```
spotter-plugin/
├── hooks.json          # Declares SessionStart hook
└── scripts/
    └── notify-session.sh  # POSTs session_id + pane_id to Spotter
```

### Why plugin over bare hooks?
- Single directory, shared by all worktrees via `--plugin-dir` CLI flag
- Multiple lifecycle events in one `hooks.json` (extensible for Stop, PostToolUse, etc.)
- ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} for portable script paths
- No per-worktree file copying needed

## Acceptance Tests
- GIVEN Claude Code starts in a tmux pane WHEN SessionStart hook fires THEN Spotter receives session_id + pane_id mapping
- GIVEN a stored mapping WHEN PaneViewLive mounts for that pane THEN it resolves the session_id
- GIVEN annotation created with session_id WHEN pane dies and restarts with same session (resume) THEN annotation still loads
- GIVEN a new worktree WHEN setup_worktree.sh runs THEN claude command includes --plugin-dir flag

## Rabbit Holes
- Hook script must be async (non-blocking) to not slow Claude startup
- Server might not be running when hook fires — script should fail silently
- Session resume vs new session — both fire SessionStart, mapping should upsert
- Pane ID stability: tmux pane IDs are stable for the pane lifetime but change on pane recreation. The SessionStart hook fires on every start AND resume, so mapping self-heals.

## No-gos
- No PID/file heuristics for session detection (plugin solves this cleanly)
- No migration of existing pane_id annotations (clean slate)
- No error-tracking hooks yet (future work)

---
Rig: spotter. Appetite: reviewed.
Target: spotter-plugin/, lib/spotter_web/, lib/spotter/transcripts/, scripts/.
Sources: lib/spotter/transcripts/annotation.ex, lib/spotter/transcripts/session.ex, lib/spotter_web/live/pane_view_live.ex, scripts/setup_worktree.sh.

title: Migrate annotation schema from pane_id to session_id
description:
Replace pane_id with session_id in the Annotation resource and add bidirectional Ash relationships.

**What and why:** Annotations must reference sessions instead of panes so they persist across tmux restarts and can be viewed alongside transcript data.

**Output files:**
- priv/repo/migrations/{timestamp}_replace_pane_id_with_session_id.exs (new)
- lib/spotter/transcripts/annotation.ex (modify)
- lib/spotter/transcripts/session.ex (modify)

**Technical specs:**

Migration (SQLite can't drop columns, so recreate table):
```elixir
execute("CREATE TABLE annotations_v2 (
  id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
  session_id TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES sessions(id),
  selected_text TEXT NOT NULL,
  start_row INTEGER NOT NULL,
  start_col INTEGER NOT NULL,
  end_row INTEGER NOT NULL,
  end_col INTEGER NOT NULL,
  comment TEXT NOT NULL,
  inserted_at TEXT NOT NULL,
  updated_at TEXT NOT NULL
)")
execute("DROP TABLE annotations")
execute("ALTER TABLE annotations_v2 RENAME TO annotations")
execute("CREATE INDEX annotations_session_id_index ON annotations(session_id)")
```

Annotation resource changes in lib/spotter/transcripts/annotation.ex:
- Remove: attribute :pane_id, :string, allow_nil?: false
- Add: attribute :session_id, :uuid, allow_nil?: false
- Add: belongs_to :session, Spotter.Transcripts.Session
- Update :create action accept list: replace :pane_id with :session_id

Session resource changes in lib/spotter/transcripts/session.ex:
- Add: has_many :annotations, Spotter.Transcripts.Annotation

**Source references:**
- lib/spotter/transcripts/annotation.ex — current schema with pane_id
- lib/spotter/transcripts/session.ex — session resource
- priv/repo/migrations/20260210232042_create_annotations.exs — current annotations table
- priv/repo/migrations/20260210221917_add_transcripts_domain.exs — sessions table schema

**Edge cases:**
- Existing annotations will be lost (accepted in no-gos)
- FK constraint: session must exist before annotation can be created — if session not yet synced, annotation create will fail. PaneViewLive must handle this.

**Definition of Done:**
- [ ] Migration runs cleanly (mix ecto.migrate)
- [ ] Annotation resource compiles with session_id attribute and belongs_to
- [ ] Session resource has has_many :annotations
- [ ] Ash.create(Annotation, %{session_id: uuid, ...}) works when session exists

title: Update PaneViewLive to use session_id for annotations
description:
Update PaneViewLive to look up session_id from the SessionRegistry and use it for all annotation operations.

**What and why:** The LiveView currently uses pane_id for annotation CRUD. Must switch to session_id resolved via the hook-populated registry.

**Output files:**
- lib/spotter_web/live/pane_view_live.ex (modify)

**Technical specs:**

In mount/3, after existing pane detection:
```elixir
session_id = Spotter.Services.SessionRegistry.get_session_id(pane_id)
socket = assign(socket, :session_id, session_id)
```

Subscribe to PubSub "pane_sessions" topic to receive updates if a session registers after mount:
```elixir
SpotterWeb.Endpoint.subscribe("pane_sessions")
```

Add handle_info for session registration events:
```elixir
def handle_info({:session_registered, pane_id, session_id}, socket) do
  if pane_id == socket.assigns.pane_id do
    socket = socket |> assign(:session_id, session_id) |> load_annotations()
    {:noreply, socket}
  else
    {:noreply, socket}
  end
end
```

Update load_annotations helper:
- Filter by session_id == ^session_id instead of pane_id == ^pane_id
- Return empty list if session_id is nil

Update handle_event("save_annotation", ...):
- Replace pane_id: socket.assigns.pane_id with session_id: socket.assigns.session_id
- Guard: only allow save when session_id is not nil

Update render:
- Show session ID in pane header (first 8 chars of UUID)
- When session_id is nil: show "Waiting for session..." message
- When session_id present: show annotation panel as before

**Source references:**
- lib/spotter_web/live/pane_view_live.ex — current implementation
- lib/spotter/services/session_registry.ex — from Task 1

**Edge cases:**
- Session not yet registered (hook hasn't fired) — show "waiting" state, update via PubSub
- Session registered but not in DB (sync hasn't run) — annotation create fails with FK error; show "Session not yet synced" message
- Non-Claude pane — session_id stays nil, annotations hidden

**Definition of Done:**
- [ ] Opening a Claude pane shows detected session ID after hook fires
- [ ] Creating annotation stores session_id (not pane_id)
- [ ] Annotations persist and reload correctly for the same session
- [ ] Non-Claude panes show appropriate message
